channel.title: [Tut][VB6] Standard form Quadratic Equation solver!
channel.description:
This is my first tutorial, be nice.
Step 1: Get VB6. If that is too difficult, please press the nice "x" in the upper right hand corner of this window.
Step 2: Open VB6 and select "Standard EXE" [no quotes], and press Open
Step 3: Add the following controls/labels to your project (I sincerely apologise for the chaotic labelling system, I might tidy this up later on) (Ignore the "View Graph" button, this is in case I want to add a graphing capability to my program later on)
[img]http://img110.imageshack.us/img110/5683/tutoriallabeldd9.jpg[/img]
Step 4: In the upper right hand corner, right click Form1(Form1), and select View Code.
Step 5: Paste the following code into the window that opens (you can chose to ignore the last 3 lines, they are for the future graphing capability):
[code] Private Sub Text1_KeyPress(KeyAscii As Integer) 'This sub prevents you from putting anything other Select Case KeyAscii 'Than numbers in the text boxes: Special thanks to Case Is < 32 'Mopar member hellou and Moderator Fretty1990 Case 45 Case 48 To 57 Case Else KeyAscii = 0 End Select End Sub
Private Sub Text2_KeyPress(KeyAscii As Integer) 'Does same as above sub for a different text box Select Case KeyAscii Case Is < 32 Case 45 Case 48 To 57 Case Else KeyAscii = 0 End Select End Sub
Private Sub Text3_KeyPress(KeyAscii As Integer) 'Does same as above sub for a different text box Select Case KeyAscii Case Is < 32 Case 45 Case 48 To 57 Case Else KeyAscii = 0 End Select End Sub
Private Sub Command1_Click()
a = Val(Text1) 'Declaring variables...
b = Val(Text2)
c = Val(Text3)
If a > 0 Then 'This IF checks if the parabola is positive (up)
Label5.Caption = "Up"
End If
If a < 0 Then 'This IF checks if the parabola is negative (down)
Label5.Caption = "Down"
End If
If Label5.Caption = "Up" Then 'This IF is showing the parabola is positive
Label2.Caption = "Min"
End If
If Label5.Caption = "Down" Then 'This IF is showing the parabola is negative
Label2.Caption = "Max"
End If
If a > 1 Then 'This IF is telling you if the parabola is stretched
Label11.Caption = "Stretched"
End If
If a = 1 Then 'This IF is telling you if the parabola is neither stretched or squished
Label11.Caption = "Neither"
End If
If a < 1 Then 'This IF is telling you if the parabola is squished
Label11.Caption = "Squished"
End If
Label13.Caption = c 'The following rest of the code is calculating the quadratic formula =)
f = -b / (2 * a)
Label15.Caption = f
r = Sqr((b ^ 2) - 4 * a * c)
w = 2 * a
o = (-b + r) / w
s = (-b - r) / w
Label17.Caption = o
Label18.Caption = s
p = (a * (f ^ 2)) + (b * f) + c
Label20.Caption = f
Label21.Caption = -p
End Sub
'Private Sub Command2_Click() 'MSChart1.Show 'End Sub [/code]
Step 6: You can either save under the "File" menu, or you can click "Make Project1.exe"
Step 7: Fill out the following form and click the "OK" button.
Congratulations! You have officially made my first VB6 program ever! Please no leeching, give me full credit, and post when you view this.
--Slayerexpert--

item.title: [Tut][VB6] Standard form Quadratic Equation solver!
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

Nice for your first tutorial…
Only 1 tiny remark… Most tutorials explain what you code instead of just “Paste that code there…”
Cuz that way people don’t really learn from it
(Just to make it perfect, it’s a Quadratic Equation solver :P)
It’s a good idea to implement this for the textboxes: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,32238.html

Read full topic

item.title: [Tut][VB6] Standard form Quadratic Equation solver!
item.dc:creator: @Slayerexpert Slayerexpert
item.description:
@Slayerexpert wrote:

This is my first tutorial, be nice.

Step 1: Get VB6. If that is too difficult, please press the nice “x” in the upper right hand corner of this window.

Step 2: Open VB6 and select “Standard EXE” [no quotes], and press Open

Step 3: Add the following controls/labels to your project (I sincerely apologise for the chaotic labelling system, I might tidy this up later on) (Ignore the “View Graph” button, this is in case I want to add a graphing capability to my program later on)

Step 4: In the upper right hand corner, right click Form1(Form1), and select View Code.

Step 5: Paste the following code into the window that opens (you can chose to ignore the last 3 lines, they are for the future graphing capability):

Private Sub Text1_KeyPress(KeyAscii As Integer)   'This sub prevents you from putting anything other
    Select Case KeyAscii                                     'Than numbers in the text boxes: Special thanks to
        Case Is < 32                                            'Mopar member hellou and Moderator Fretty1990
        Case 45
        Case 48 To 57
        Case Else
            KeyAscii = 0
    End Select
End Sub

Private Sub Text2_KeyPress(KeyAscii As Integer)    'Does same as above sub for a different text box
    Select Case KeyAscii
        Case Is < 32
        Case 45
        Case 48 To 57
        Case Else
            KeyAscii = 0
    End Select
End Sub

Private Sub Text3_KeyPress(KeyAscii As Integer)    'Does same as above sub for a different text box
    Select Case KeyAscii
        Case Is < 32
        Case 45
        Case 48 To 57
        Case Else
            KeyAscii = 0
    End Select
End Sub

Private Sub Command1_Click()

a = Val(Text1)    'Declaring variables...

b = Val(Text2)

c = Val(Text3)

If a > 0 Then     'This IF checks if the parabola is positive (up)

Label5.Caption = "Up"

End If

If a < 0 Then      'This IF checks if the parabola is negative (down)

Label5.Caption = "Down"

End If

If Label5.Caption = "Up" Then     'This IF is showing the parabola is positive

Label2.Caption = "Min"

End If

If Label5.Caption = "Down" Then   'This IF is showing the parabola is negative

Label2.Caption = "Max"

End If

If a > 1 Then        'This IF is telling you if the parabola is stretched

Label11.Caption = "Stretched"

End If

If a = 1 Then       'This IF is telling you if the parabola is neither stretched or squished

Label11.Caption = "Neither"

End If

If a < 1 Then       'This IF is telling you if the parabola is squished

Label11.Caption = "Squished"

End If

Label13.Caption = c    'The following rest of the code is calculating the quadratic formula =)

f = -b / (2 * a)

Label15.Caption = f

r = Sqr((b ^ 2) - 4 * a * c)

w = 2 * a

o = (-b + r) / w

s = (-b - r) / w

Label17.Caption = o

Label18.Caption = s

p = (a * (f ^ 2)) + (b * f) + c

Label20.Caption = f

Label21.Caption = -p

End Sub

'Private Sub Command2_Click()
'MSChart1.Show
'End Sub

Step 6: You can either save under the “File” menu, or you can click “Make Project1.exe”

Step 7: Fill out the following form and click the “OK” button.

Congratulations! You have officially made my first VB6 program ever!
Please no leeching, give me full credit, and post when you view this.

–Slayerexpert–

Read full topic
